intro: Cyathea mascarena, commonly known as the Mascarene tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant has a robust rhizome system that allows it to thrive in moist, shaded environments. Its fronds can reach lengths of up to 3 meters, making it a striking feature in tropical forests. Cyathea mascarena plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability in its native habitat.
